body_html:
In my case i was getting seg fault 11 when importing tensorflow to my virtual env python.
Then I suspected I was doing some rookie mistake in my .bash_profile.
I found this link
The tell you to add this to your bash:
export CUDA_HOME="/usr/local/cuda"
export DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH="$CUDA_HOME/lib:$DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH"
export PATH="$CUDA_HOME/bin:$PATH"
I suspect it is crucial to define a CUDA_HOME variable on your bash.
Now my tensorflow is up and running on python.

body:
In my case i was getting seg fault 11 when importing tensorflow to my virtual env python.
Then I suspected I was doing some rookie mistake in my .bash_profile.
I found [this link](http://mxnet.io/get_started/osx_setup.html)
The tell you to add this to your bash:
`export CUDA_HOME="/usr/local/cuda"`
`export DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH="$CUDA_HOME/lib:$DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH"`
 `export PATH="$CUDA_HOME/bin:$PATH"`
I suspect it is crucial to define a CUDA_HOME variable on your bash.
Now my tensorflow is up and running on python.
